description: '''Robert Patrick Weston''' ({{ne}} '''Harris'''; 7 March 1878 â€“ 6 November 1936) was an English songwriter. He was responsible for many successful songs and comic monologues between the 1900s and 1930s, mostly written in collaboration with other writers, notably [[Fred J. Barnes]] and [[Bert Lee]], and performed successfully by [[Harry Champion]], [[Stanley Holloway]], and [[Gracie Fields]], among others.
